semantic_title: Sequencing of Burn and Related Condition Codes - Priority Rules
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 19. Injury, Poisoning, and Certain Other Consequences of External Causes > d. Coding of Burns and Corrosions > 1) Sequencing of burn and related condition codes

content.full_text: Sequence first the code that reflects the highest degree of burn when more than one burn is present. a. When the reason for the admission or encounter is for treatment of external multiple burns, sequence first the code that reflects the burn of the highest degree. b. When a patient has both internal and external burns, the circumstances of admission govern the selection of the principal diagnosis or first-listed diagnosis. c. When a patient is admitted for burn injuries and other related conditions such as smoke inhalation and/or respiratory failure, the circumstances of admission govern the selection of the principal or first-listed diagnosis. (Evidence: pg no: 81, L71-L78)
content.summary: Sequencing rules for burn codes prioritizing highest degree burns and using circumstances of admission to determine principal diagnosis when multiple conditions are present (Evidence: pg no: 81, L71-L78)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Sequence first the code that reflects the highest degree of burn when more than one burn is present (Evidence: pg no: 81, L71-L72)
detailed_rules.explanation: The most severe burn (highest degree) takes sequencing priority regardless of anatomical location (Evidence: pg no: 81, L71-L72)

detailed_rules.rule_text: When the reason for the admission or encounter is for treatment of external multiple burns, sequence first the code that reflects the burn of the highest degree (Evidence: pg no: 81, L72-L73)
detailed_rules.explanation: For external burns specifically, highest degree burn is sequenced first when multiple burns are the reason for admission (Evidence: pg no: 81, L72-L73)

detailed_rules.rule_text: When a patient has both internal and external burns, the circumstances of admission govern the selection of the principal diagnosis or first-listed diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 81, L74)
detailed_rules.explanation: Clinical circumstances and treatment focus determine sequencing when both internal and external burns are present (Evidence: pg no: 81, L74)

detailed_rules.rule_text: When a patient is admitted for burn injuries and other related conditions such as smoke inhalation and/or respiratory failure, the circumstances of admission govern the selection of the principal or first-listed diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 81, L77-L78)
detailed_rules.explanation: Treatment focus and clinical circumstances determine principal diagnosis when burns occur with related conditions (Evidence: pg no: 81, L77-L78)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify all burns and related conditions
Step 2: Determine degrees of all burns present
Step 3: For multiple burns, sequence highest degree first
Step 4: For internal/external burns, assess circumstances of admission
Step 5: For burns with related conditions, determine treatment focus
Step 6: Sequence principal diagnosis based on circumstances
